page.title: 01Local History.
page.content: Local History. The village of Newport was developed as the Market Weighton Canal was cut. The canal drained an area of marshy pasture land,known as Waling Fen.The village grew along the sides of the canal and the road,and the village became a new port on the canal,hence the name,Newport. When the canal was completed in 1780, clay, suitable for bricks was found and a brickworks was established at the side of the canal.The hollows where the clay was taken from soon filled with water.There are now many large ponds,which are a feature of Newport. Newport is in the process of change as the brickworks closed in 1974. There are two new housing estates in the village,housing a population who commute to gain employment.
